 14470                                  section .SYSINIT vstart=0
 14471                                  
 14472                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 14473                                  ; SYSINIT.BIN (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) - RETRO DOS v4.0 by ERDOGAN TAN - 21/10/2022
 14474                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14475                                  ; Last Update: 04/01/2023 (Modified IO.SYS)  ((Previous: 30/12/2022))
 14476                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14477                                  ; Beginning: 03/06/2018 (Retro DOS 3.0), 21/03/2019 (Retro DOS 4.0)
 14478                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14479                                  ; Assembler: NASM version 2.15
 14480                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14481                                  ;	   ((nasm sysinit6.s -l sysinit6.lst -o SYSINIT6.BIN -Z error.txt)) 	
 14482                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14483                                  ; Modified from 'sysinit2.s' (SYSINIT2.BIN) file of Retro DOS v3.0 (6/7/2018)
 14484                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14485                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT1.ASM' and 'SYSINIT2.ASM' files of MSDOS 6.0
 14486                                  ; source code by Microsoft, 1991 
 14487                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14488                                  ; Derived from 'SYSINIT.ASM' file of MSDOS 2.0 (IBM PCDOS v2.0) source code
 14489                                  ; by Microsoft, 12/10/1983
 14490                                  ; ****************************************************************************
 14491                                  ; main file: 'retrodos4.s'
 14492                                  ; incbin 'SYSINIT3.BIN' ; (SYINITSEG)
 14493                                  
 14494                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 14495                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 - 2019
 14496                                  ; SYSINIT (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS) draft: 'sysinit3.s' (01/07/2019)
 14497                                   
 14498                                  ; 21/10/2022
 14499                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14500                                  ; This source code (version) is based on SYSINIT source code of disassembled
 14501                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS file (SYSINIT.BIN) 
 14502                                  ; Dissassembler: Hex-Rays Interactive Disassembler (IDA)
 14503                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14504                                  ; Binary file splitter & joiner: FFSJ v3.3
 14505                                  
 14506                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 14507                                  ; SYSINIT.TXT (27/01/1983)
 14508                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 14509                                  ;    SYSINIT is  a module linked behind the OEM bios.  It takes
 14510                                  ;over  the  system  initialization  after  the  OEM  bios   has
 14511                                  ;performed any  initialization  it  needs  to  do.   Control is
 14512                                  ;transfered with a long jump to the external  variable  SYSINIT
 14513                                  ;
 14514                                  ;
 14515                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared external:
 14516                                  ;
 14517                                  ;   CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION    WORD
 14518                                  ;
 14519                                  ;This word  contains  the  segment  number of the DOS before it
 14520                                  ;is relocated.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 14521                                  ;
 14522                                  ;   FINAL_DOS_LOCATION      WORD
 14523                                  ;
 14524                                  ;This word contains the segment number of the DOS after SYSINIT
 14525                                  ;moves it.  The OEM bios must set this value.
 14526                                  ;
 14527                                  ;   DEVICE_LIST             DWORD
 14528                                  ;
 14529                                  ;This  double  word  pointer  points  to  the  linked  list  of
 14530                                  ;character and block device drivers.  The  OEM  must  set  this
 14531                                  ;value.
 14532                                  ;
 14533                                  ;   MEMORY_SIZE             WORD
 14534                                  ;
 14535                                  ;This word  contains  the  number  of  RAM  paragraphs.  If the
 14536                                  ;bios doesn't set  this  variable  SYSINIT  will  automatically
 14537                                  ;calculate it.   NOTE:  systems with PARITY checked memory must
 14538                                  ;size memory in the BIOS.  SYSINITs method is to  write  memory
 14539                                  ;and read it back until it gets a mismatch.
 14540                                  ;
 14541                                  ;   DEFAULT_DRIVE           BYTE
 14542                                  ;
 14543                                  ;This is  the initial default drive when the system first comes
 14544                                  ;up.  drive a=0, drive b=1,  etc.   If  the  bios  doesn't  set
 14545                                  ;it then drive a is assumed.
 14546                                  ;
 14547                                  ;   BUFFERS                 BYTE
 14548                                  ;
 14549                                  ;This is  the  default  number of buffers for the system.  This
 14550                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 14551                                  ;It is DBed to 2 in SYSINIT it should be greater than 1.
 14552                                  ;
 14553                                  ;   FILES                   BYTE
 14554                                  ;
 14555                                  ;This is  the  default  number  of  files for the system.  This
 14556                                  ;value may be overridden by the user in  the  CONFIG.SYS  file.
 14557                                  ;It is  DBed  to  8 in SYSINIT, values less than 5 are ignored.
 14558                                  ;
 14559                                  ;   SYSINIT                 FAR
 14560                                  ;
 14561                                  ;The entry  point  of  the  SYSINIT  module.  OEM BIOS jumps to
 14562                                  ;this label at the end of its INIT code.
 14563                                  ;
 14564                                  ;   The OEM  has  the  following  variables declared public:
 14565                                  ;
 14566                                  ;   RE_INIT                 FAR
 14567                                  ;
 14568                                  ;This is an entry point which allows the BIOS to do some INIT
 14569                                  ;work  after  the  DOS is initialized.  ALL REGISTERS MUST BE
 14570                                  ;PRESERVED.  On entry DS points to the first available memory
 14571                                  ;(after  the DOS).  DS:0 points to a 100H byte program header
 14572                                  ;prefix which represents  the  "program"  currently  running.
 14573                                  ;This  program  should  be  thought  of  as  the OEM BIOS and
 14574                                  ;SYSINIT taken together.  This is not  a  normal  program  in
 14575                                  ;that  no  memory  is  allocated to it, it is running in free
 14576                                  ;memory.
 14577                                  ;NOTES:
 14578                                  ;     At the time this routine is called SYSINIT occupies the
 14579                                  ;highest 10K of memory ("highest" is determined by the  value
 14580                                  ;of the MEMORY_SIZE variable), DO NOT DO WRITES THERE.
 14581                                  ;     Since this is called AFTER DOS is initialized, you can
 14582                                  ;make system calls.  This also implies that the code for this
 14583                                  ;routine    CANNOT   be   thrown   away   by   use   of   the
 14584                                  ;FINAL_DOS_LOCATION since the DOS has already been moved.
 14585                                  ;     If you don't want  anything done just set this to point
 14586                                  ;at a FAR RET instruction.
 14587                                  
 14588                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14589                                  ; TITLE   BIOS SYSTEM INITIALIZATION
 14590                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14591                                  
 14592                                  ;include version.inc
 14593                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14594                                  
 14595                                  ;FALSE   EQU     0
 14596                                  ;TRUE    EQU     0FFFFh
 14597                                  
 14598                                  ;IBMVER	    EQU     TRUE
 14599                                  ;IBMCOPYRIGHT EQU   FALSE
 14600                                  ;STACKSW    EQU	    TRUE		;Include Switchable Hardware Stacks
 14601                                  ;IBMJAPVER  EQU     FALSE		; If TRUE set KANJI true also
 14602                                  ;MSVER      EQU     FALSE
 14603                                  ;ALTVECT    EQU     FALSE		; Switch to build ALTVECT version
 14604                                  ;KANJI      EQU     FALSE
 14605                                  
 14606                                  ;(MSDOS 6.0, versiona.inc, 1991)
 14607                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14608                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION  EQU	6
 14609                                  ;;MINOR_VERSION	EQU	0	;6.00
 14610                                  ;MINOR_VERSION  EQU	21	;6.21  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14611                                  
 14612                                  ; 22/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0)
 14613                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14614                                  ;MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	5
 14615                                  ;MINOR_VERSION   EQU	0
 14616                                  
 14617                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21)
 14618                                  MAJOR_VERSION   EQU	6
 14619                                  MINOR_VERSION   EQU	22
 14620                                  
 14621                                  expected_version equ	(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION
 14622                                  
 14623                                  ;DOSREVNM equ	00000000b       ; m037 - bits 0-2 = revision number of DOS
 14624                                  				; currently 0.
 14625                                  DOSREVNM equ	00000111b	; [[[ 7 for Retro DOS v4.0 ]]] (21/03/2019)	
 14626                                  DOSINROM equ	00001000B       ; bit 3 of ver flags returned in BH
 14627                                  DOSINHMA equ	00010000B       ; bit 4 of ver flags 
 14628                                  
 14629                                  ;      if1
 14630                                  ;      %OUT  ... for DOS Version 5.00 ...
 14631                                  ;      endif
 14632                                  
 14633                                         ;******************************
 14634                                         ;Each assembler program should:
 14635                                         ;  mov ah,030h                   ;DOS Get Version function
 14636                                         ;  int 021h                      ;Version ret. in AX,minor version first
 14637                                         ;  cmp ax,expected_version       ;ALL utilities should check for an
 14638                                         ;  jne error_handler             ; EXACT version match.
 14639                                         ;******************************
 14640                                  
 14641                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14642                                  ; device definitions
 14643                                  
 14644                                  ;Attribute bit masks
 14645                                  DEVTYP  EQU     8000h           ;Bit 15 - 1  if Char, 0 if block
 14646                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000h           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
 14647                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000h           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
 14648                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001h           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
 14649                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002h           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
 14650                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004h           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
 14651                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008h           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
 14652                                  ISIBM   EQU     0010h           ;Bit 4 - This device is special
 14653                                  
 14654                                  ; The device table list has the form:
 14655                                  struc	SYSDEV
 14656 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
 14657 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
 14658 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
 14659 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
 14660 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
 14661                                  .size:
 14662                                  endstruc
 14663                                  
 14664                                  ;Static Reguest Header
 14665                                  struc	SRHEAD
 14666 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
 14667 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 14668 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 14669 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 14670 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 14671                                  .size:
 14672                                  endstruc
 14673                                  
 14674                                  ;Status word masks
 14675                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 14676                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 14677                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 14678                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 14679                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 14680                                  
 14681                                  ;Function codes
 14682                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 14683                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 14684                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 14685                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 14686                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
 14687                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
 14688                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
 14689                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
 14690                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
 14691                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 14692                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 14693                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
 14694                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
 14695                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
 14696                                  DFLSHL  EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
 14697                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
 14698                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
 14699                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
 14700                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
 14701                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
 14702                                  
 14703                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14704                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 14705 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 14706 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 14707 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 14708 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 14709 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 14710 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 14711                                                          ; word
 14712 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 14713 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 14714 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 14715 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 14716                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 14717                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 14718                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 14719                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 14720                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 14721                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 14722                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 14723                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 14724 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 14725 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 14726 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 14727 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 14728 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 14729 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 14730                                  .size:
 14731                                  endstruc
 14732                                  
 14733                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14734                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 14735                                  
 14736                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 14737                                  
 14738                                  struc buffinfo
 14739 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 14740 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 14741 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 14742                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 14743                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 14744 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 14745                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 14746                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 14747                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 14748                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 14749                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 14750                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 14751                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 14752                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 14753 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 14754                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 14755 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 14756 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 14757 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 14758 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 14759 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 14760                                  .size:
 14761                                  endstruc
 14762                                  
 14763                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 14764                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 14765                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 14766                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 14767                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 14768                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 14769                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 14770                                  
 14771                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 14772                                  
 14773                                  
 14774                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 14775                                  
 14776                                  ;Flag byte masks
 14777                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 14778                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 14779                                  ;***
 14780                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 14781                                  ;***
 14782                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 14783                                  
 14784                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 14785                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 14786                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 14787                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 14788                                  
 14789                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 14790

 14792                                  
 14793                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 14794                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 14795                                  
 14796                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 14797                                  
 14798                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 14799                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 14800                                  ;
 14801                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 14802                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 14803                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 14804                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 14805                                  ;
 14806                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 14807                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 14808                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 14809                                  
 14810                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 14811                                  
 14812                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14813                                  
 14814                                  struc	DPB
 14815 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 14816 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 14817 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 14818 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 14819 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 14820 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 14821 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 14822 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 14823 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 14824 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 14825                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 14826 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 14827 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 14828 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 14829 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 14830 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 14831                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 14832 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 14833 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 14834 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 14835                                  .size:
 14836                                  endstruc
 14837                                  
 14838                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 14839                                  
 14840                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)
 14841

 14897                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 14898                                  
 14899                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 14900                                  ;
 14901                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 14902                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 14903                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 14904                                  ;
 14905                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 14906                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 14907                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 14908                                  ;
 14909                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 14910                                  
 14911                                  struc A_BPB
 14912 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 14913 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 14914 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 14915 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 14916 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 14917 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 14918 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 14919 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 14920 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 14921 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 14922 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 14923 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 14924 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 14925 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 14926 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 14927                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 14928                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 14929                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 14930                                  .size:
 14931                                  endstruc
 14932                                  
 14933                                  struc A_DEVICEPARAMETERS
 14934 00000000 ??                      .DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS:	resb	1
 14935 00000001 ??                      .DP_DEVICETYPE:		resb	1
 14936 00000002 ????                    .DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES:	resw	1
 14937 00000004 ????                    .DP_CYLINDERS:		resw	1
 14938 00000006 ??                      .DP_MEDIATYPE:		resb	1
 14939 00000007 <res 1Fh>               .DP_BPB:		resb	A_BPB.size
 14940 00000026 ????                    .DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES:	resw	1
 14941 00000028 <res FCh>               .DP_SECTORTABLE:	resb	MAX_SECTORS_IN_TRACK * A_SECTORTABLE.size
 14942                                  endstruc

 15190                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15191                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 15192                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15193                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 15194                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 15195                                  									  
 15196                                  ;*******************************					  
 15197                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 15198                                  ;*******************************					  
 15199                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 15200                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 15201                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 15202                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15203                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 15204                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 15205                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 15206                                  ;For all others:							  
 15207                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 15208                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 15209                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 15210                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 15211                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 15212                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 15213                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 15214                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 15215                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15216                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 15217                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 15218                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 15219                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 15220                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 15221                                  ;									  
 15222                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 15223                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 15224                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 15225                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 15226                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 15227                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 15228                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 15229                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 15230                                  ;									  
 15231                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 15232                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 15233                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 15234                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 15235                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 15236                                  ;									  
 15237                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 15238                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 15239                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 15240                                  ;									  
 15241                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 15242                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 15243                                  ;									  
 15244                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 15245                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 15246                                  ;									  
 15247                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 15248                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 15249                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 15250                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 15251                                  ;						called. 		  
 15252                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 15253                                  ;									  
 15254                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15255                                  ;									  
 15256                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15257                                  ;									  
 15258                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15259                                  ;									  
 15260                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 15261                                  ;									  
 15262                                  
 15263                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 15264                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 15265 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 15266 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 15267                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 15268 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15269 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 15270 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 15271 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 15272                                  endstruc					  
 15273

 15275                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 15276                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 15277                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 15278                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 15279                                  					;;End of Modification

 15381                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15382                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15383                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15384                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15385                                  
 15386                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 15387                                  ;
 15388                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 15389                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 15390                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 15391                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 15392                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 15393                                  ;
 15394                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 15395                                  ;
 15396                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 15397                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 15398                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 15399                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 15400                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 15401                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 15402                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 15403                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 15404                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 15405                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 15406                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 15407                                  
 15408                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 15409                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 15410                                  
 15411                                  struc 		curdir_list
 15412                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15413 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 15414 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 15415 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 15416 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 15417 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 15418 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 15419                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 15420 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 15421 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 15422 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 15423                                  .size:
 15424                                  endstruc
 15425                                  
 15426                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 15427                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 15428                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 15429                                  						; argument
 15430                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 15431

 15441                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15442                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 15443                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15444                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15445                                  
 15446                                  ; system file table
 15447                                  
 15448                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 15449                                  ;
 15450                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 15451                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 15452                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 15453                                  
 15454                                  struc	SF
 15455 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 15456 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 15457 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 15458                                  .size:
 15459                                  endstruc
 15460                                  
 15461                                  ;**	System file table entry
 15462                                  ;
 15463                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 15464                                  
 15465                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 15466 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 15467                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 15468 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 15469 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 15470 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 15471                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 15472                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 15473                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 15474                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 15475                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 15476                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 15477                                  					;   (WRITE)
 15478                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 15479                                  					;
 15480                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 15481                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 15482                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 15483                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 15484                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 15485                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 15486                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15487                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15488                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15489                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15490                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 15491                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15492 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 15493                                  					; to device header if local device,
 15494                                  					; points to net device header if
 15495                                  					; remote
 15496 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 15497                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 15498 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 15499 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 15500 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 15501 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 15502                                  ;
 15503                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 15504                                  ; ID
 15505                                  ;
 15506 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 15507 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 15508 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 15509                                  ;
 15510                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 15511                                  ;
 15512 0000001E <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 15513                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 15514                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 15515                                  					; disk changed errors.
 15516                                  ; SHARING INFO
 15517 00000029 ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF

 15795                                  SYSINIT$:
 15796                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 15797                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 15802                                  
 15803                                  ; 05/07/2018
 15804                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15805                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 15806                                  
 15807                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15808                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 15809                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15810                                  
 15811                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 15812                                  ;
 15813                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 15814                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 15815                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 15816                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 15817                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 15818                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 15819                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 15820                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 15821                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 15822                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 15823                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 15824                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 15825                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 15826                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 15827                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 15828                                  ;
 15829                                  
 15830                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 15831                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 15832                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 15833                                  ;
 15834                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 15835                                  ;
 15836                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 15837                                  ;
 15838                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 15839                                  ;
 15840                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 15841                                  ;
 15842                                  
 15843                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 15844                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 15845                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 15846                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 15847                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 15848                                  ;      deeply nested one
 15849                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 15850                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 15851                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 15852                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 15853                                  
 15854                                  		;EVEN
 15855                                  ;align 2
 15856                                  		; 21/10/2022
 15857                                  
 15858 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 15859 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 15860 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 15861 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 15862 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 15863 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 15864                                  
 15865 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 15866 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 15867 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 15868                                  
 15869                                  ;***********************************************************************
 15870                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 15871                                  
 15872                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15873                                  
 15874 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 15875                                  
 15876                                  int02:
 15877                                  
 15878                                  ; *********************************************************************
 15879                                  ;
 15880                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 15881                                  ;
 15882                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 15883                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 15884                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 15885                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 15886                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 15887                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 15888                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 15889                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 15890                                  ;
 15891                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 15892                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 15893                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 15894                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 15895                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 15896                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 15897                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 15898                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 15899                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 15900                                  ;
 15901                                  ; *********************************************************************
 15902                                  
 15903 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 15904 00000017 06                      	push	es
 15905 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 15906 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 15907                                  	; 02/11/2022
 15908 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 15909 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 15910 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 15911                                  
 15912 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 15913                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 15914                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 15915                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 15916                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 15917 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 15918 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 15919                                  special02:
 15920 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 15921 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 15922                                  normal02:
 15923 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 15924 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 15925 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 16152                                  
 16153                                  ;********************************************************************
 16154                                  ;common routines
 16155                                  ;********************************************************************
 16156                                  
 16157                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 16158                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 16159                                  ; service routine
 16160                                  
 16161                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 16162                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16163                                  
 16164                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 16165                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 16166                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 16167                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 16168                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 16169                                  
 16170                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 16171                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO:SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 16172                                  
 16173                                  do_int_stacks:
 16174 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 16175 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 16176 00000149 06                      	push	es
 16177 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 16178 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 16179 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 16180                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16181                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 16182                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16183 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 16184 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 16185 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 16186                                  
 16187 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 16188                                  
 16189                                  found02:
 16190 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 16191 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 16192                                  
 16193 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 16194                                  
 16195 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 16196                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16197                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 16198                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16199                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 16200 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 16201 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 16202                                  
 16203                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 16204                                  	;mov	es,bp
 16205                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 16206                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 16207                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 16208                                  	;mov	sp,es
 16209                                  	;mov	es,ax
 16210                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 16211                                  
 16212                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 16213 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 16214 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 16215 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 16216 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 16217 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 16218 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 16219 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 16220 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 16221                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16222                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 16223 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 16224                                  
 16225 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 16226                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16227 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 16228                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16229                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 16230                                  
 16231 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 16232                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16233 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 16234                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16235                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 16236 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 16237 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 16238                                  
 16239                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16240                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 16241                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16242 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 16243 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 16244                                  
 16245 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 16246 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 16247 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 16248 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 16249 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 16250                                  
 16251                                  notfree02:
 16252 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 16253 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 16254                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16255                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 16256                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16257 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16258                                  
 16259                                  findnext02:
 16260 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 16261 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 16262                                  
 16263                                  foundbad02:
 16264 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16265 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 16266 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 16267                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16268                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 16269                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16270 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 16271 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 16272                                  
 16273                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16274                                  
 16275                                  ; Common routines
 16276                                  
 16277                                  longpath:
 16278                                  	; 21/03/2019
 16279 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 16280                                  lploopp:
 16281                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16282                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 16283                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16284 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 16285 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 16286                                  
 16287 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 16288                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16289                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 16290                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16291 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 16292 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 16293 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 16294                                  
 16295 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 16296 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 16297                                  
 16298                                  	; 11/12/2022
 16299                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 16300                                  	; 21/10/2022
 16301 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 16302                                  inuse:
 16303 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 16304 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 16305 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 16306 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 16307                                  found:
 16308 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 16309                                  fatal:
 16310 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 16311 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 16312 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 16313 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 16314 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 16315 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 16316                                  
 16317 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 16318 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 16319                                  
 16320                                  skip_nmis:
 16321 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 16322 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 16323 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 16324 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 16325                                  
 16326 0000020E 8CCE                    	mov	si,cs
 16327 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 16328 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg

 16330                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 16331                                  ;

 16333 00000216 1E                      	push	ds

 17567                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 17568                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 17569                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 17570                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 17571                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 17572                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 17573                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 17574                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 17575                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 17576                                  ;
 17577                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 17578                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 17579                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 17580                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 17581                                  ; been patched.

 17897                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"
 17898                                  ;   in memory, can be trashed (and in fact is -- see references to retry
 17899                                  ;   which follow....)
 17900                                  
 17901                                  retry:
 17902 00000780 BA[0347]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 17903                                  
 17904                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 17905                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 17906                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 17907                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 17908                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 17909                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 17910                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 17911                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 17912                                  
 17913                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 17914                                  
 17915 00000783 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 17916 00000784 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 17917 00000787 B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 17918 00000789 CD21                            int     21h             ; get biggest piece
 17919 0000078B B448                    	mov	ah,48h	; ALLOC
 17920 0000078D CD21                    	int	21h		; second time gets it
 17921 0000078F 726B                    	jc	short memerrjx	; oooops
 17922                                  
 17923 00000791 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 17924 00000793 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 17925 00000795 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 17926 00000797 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 17927                                  
 17928                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 17929                                  
 17930                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 17931                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 17932                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 17933                                  
 17934                                  	; 22/10/2022
 17935                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)
 17936 00000799 8B1E[9202]                      mov     bx,[MEMORY_SIZE] ; get location of end of memory
 17937 0000079D 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 17938                                  
 17939                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 17940                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 17941                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 17942                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 17943                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 17944                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 17945                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 17946                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 17947                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 17948                                  ;
 17949                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 17950                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 17951                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 17952                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 17953                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 17954                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 17955                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 17956                                  
 17957                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 17958                                  	; (SYSINIT:0858h)

 18272                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 18273                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
