 18369                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18370                                  ;
 18371                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18372                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18373                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18374                                  ;
 18375                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18376                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18377                                  ; 
 18378                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18379                                  
 18380                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18381                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18382                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 18383                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18384                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18385                                  	; ds = cs
 18386 00000971 E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 18387 00000974 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 18388                                  
 18389                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18390                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18391                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 18392                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18393                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18394                                  	; ds = cs
 18395 00000976 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 18396                                  ;else
 18397                                  ;	..
 18398                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18399                                  
 18400                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18401                                  	; ds = cs
 18402 0000097A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 18403                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 18404 0000097C FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 18405                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 18406 00000980 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 18407 00000985 F8                      	clc
 18408                                  ttldhx:
 18409 00000986 C3                      	retn
 18410                                  
 18411                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18412                                  ;
 18413                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18414                                  ;
 18415                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18416                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18417                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18418                                  ;
 18419                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18420                                  ;
 18421                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18422                                  
 18423                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18424                                  MovDOSHi:
 18425                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18426                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18427                                  	; ds = cs

 18429 0000098A 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18430 0000098C B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18431 0000098F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18432                                  
 18433                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18434                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18435                                  
 18436                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18437                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18438                                  	
 18439                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18441                                  
 18442                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18443                                  	
 18444                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18445                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18446                                  	;xor	di,di
 18447                                  	
 18448                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18449                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18450                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18451                                  	; ds = cs
 18452 00000994 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18453 00000998 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18454                                  
 18455                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18456                                  ;else
 18457                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18458                                  ;
 18459                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18460                                  ;
 18461                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18462

 18464 0000099E F8                      	clc
 18465                                  mdhx:
 18466 0000099F C3                      	retn

 18742                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18743                                  	; 14/05/2019

 18746                                  	;mov	ax,BCode_end
 18747                                  	;sub	ax,BCode_start		; BIOS code size
 18748                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18750                                  					; 30/12/2022
 18751                                  	;sub	ax,BCODE_START ; 30h
 18752                                  	; 09/12/2022
 18753 000009EE 2D[3000]                	sub	ax,BCODESTART 
 18754                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 
 18755                                  	; 02/11/2022
 18756                                  	;add	ax,[cs:lo_doscod_size]	; DOS code size
 18757                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18758                                  	; ds = cs
 18759 000009F1 0306[7F02]              	add	ax,[lo_doscod_size]
 18760 000009F5 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 18761 000009F8 E86802                  	call	off_to_para			; convert to para
 18762                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18763                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18764                                  	;inc	ax ; + 1 paragraph for MCB
 18765 000009FB 09DB                    	or	bx,bx				; M012
 18766 000009FD 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax				;  can we use int 21 for alloc
 18767 000009FF 741A                    	jz	short update_arena		; M012
 18768 00000A01 B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 18769 00000A03 CD21                    	int	21h
 18770 00000A05 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED
 18771                                   	; 23/10/2022
 18772                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)
 18773 00000A07 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				; Take care ORG 30h of
 18774                                  						;  BIOS code
 18775 00000A0A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18776                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 18777                                  	;mov	word [es:20h+ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 18778                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18779                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],08h	; mark it as system
 18780                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'	;  code area
 18781                                  	; 23/10/2022

 18783 00000A13 26C70628005343          	mov	word [es:20h+8],'SC'		;  code area
 18784                                  
 18785 00000A1A C3                      	retn
 18786                                  
 18787                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 18788                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 18789                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 18790                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 18791                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 18792                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 18793                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 18794                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 18795                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 18796                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 18797                                  ;	  stub will go.
 18798                                  ;
 18799                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 18800                                  
 18801                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18802                                  update_arena:
 18803 00000A1B 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 18804 00000A1C 57                      	push	di
 18805 00000A1D 51                      	push	cx
 18806 00000A1E 52                      	push	dx
 18807                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18808                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 18809                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18810                                  	; ds = cs 
 18811 00000A1F C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 18812 00000A23 4F                      	dec	di
 18813 00000A24 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 18814                                  						;  before sysvar
 18815 00000A25 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 18816                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 18817 00000A27 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 18818 00000A2C 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 18819 00000A2E 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 18820                                  
 18821                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 18822 00000A30 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 18823 00000A35 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 18824 00000A37 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 18825 00000A39 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 18826 00000A3B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 18827                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 18828 00000A3D 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 18829                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 18830 00000A41 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 18831 00000A47 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 18832                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 18833 00000A49 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 18834 00000A4D 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 18835                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18836                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 18837 00000A4F 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 18838 00000A52 5A                      	pop	dx
 18839 00000A53 59                      	pop	cx
 18840 00000A54 5F                      	pop	di
 18841 00000A55 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 18842 00000A56 C3                      	retn
 18843                                  ;
 18844                                  ; M012 : END
 18845                                  ;
 18846                                  FatalErr:
 18847 00000A57 0E                      	push	cs
 18848 00000A58 1F                      	pop	ds
 18849 00000A59 BA[2109]                	mov	dx,FEmsg

 18852                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"

 18854 00000A60 E93F07                  	jmp	stall

 18856                                  	;cli
 18857                                  	;hlt

 18861                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18862                                  
 18863                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18864                                  ;
 18865                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 18866                                  ;
 18867                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 18868                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 18869                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 18870                                  ;
 18871                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 18872                                  ;
 18873                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18874                                  
 18875                                  AllocHMA:
 18876                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 18877                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 18878                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 18879                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 18880                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 18881                                  
 18882                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 18883                                  ;
 18884                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 18885                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 18886                                  ;	push	ax
 18887                                  ;	popf
 18888                                  ;	pushf
 18889                                  ;	pop	ax
 18890                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 18891                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 18892                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 18893                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 18894                                  
 18895                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18896                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 18897                                  
 18898 00000A63 1E                      	push	ds
 18899                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 18900                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 18901                                  	; 21/10/2022

 19033                                  
 19034                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19035                                  ;
 19036                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19037                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19038                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19039                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19040                                  ;
 19041                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19042                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19043                                  ;
 19044                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19045                                  
 19046                                  StartVDHead:
 19047                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19048                                  
 19049 00000ADB 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19050 00000ADF 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19051 00000AE1 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19052 00000AE3 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19053 00000AE5 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19054                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19055 00000AE6 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19056                                  VDiskSig1:
 19057 00000AED 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19058                                  
 19059                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19060                                  
 19061 00000AF2 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19062                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19063 00000AF8 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19064 00000B07 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19065 00000B09 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19066                                  VDInt19:
 19067 00000B0A EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19068                                  OldVDInt19:
 19069 00000B0B 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19070                                  
 19071                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19072                                  
 19073                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19074 00000B0F 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19075                                  VDiskSig2:
 19076 00000B12 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19077                                  
 19078                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19079                                  
 19080 00000B17 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19081 00000B1A 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19082 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19083 00000B1D 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19084 00000B1F 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19085 00000B20 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19086 00000B22 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19087 00000B24 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19088 00000B25 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19089 00000B27 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19090 00000B29 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19091 00000B2B 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19092 00000B2D 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19093                                  
 19094                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 19096                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19097                                  ;
 19098                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19099                                  ;
 19100                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19101                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19102                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19103                                  ;
 19104                                  ; Inputs : None
 19105                                  ;
 19106                                  ; Outputs : None
 19107                                  ;
 19108                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19109                                  ;
 19110                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19111                                  
 19112                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19113                                  
 19114                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19115 00000B2F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19116 00000B31 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19117                                  
 19118                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19119                                  
 19120                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19121 00000B33 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19122                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19123 00000B36 2EA3[0B0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19124 00000B3A A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19125                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19126 00000B3D 2EA3[0D0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19127                                  
 19128                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19129                                  
 19130 00000B41 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19131                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19132                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19133 00000B43 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19134 00000B46 CD21                    	int	21h
 19135                                  
 19136                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19137                                  
 19138 00000B48 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19139 00000B49 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19140                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19141 00000B4B 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19142                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19143 00000B52 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19144 00000B59 40                      	inc	ax
 19145 00000B5A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19146                                  
 19147                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19148                                  
 19149 00000B5C FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 19150                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 19151 00000B5D C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 19152 00000B63 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 19153                                  
 19154                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 19155                                  
 19156                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 19157 00000B66 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 19158 00000B69 BE[DB0A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 19159 00000B6C 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 19160 00000B6E 0E                      	push	cs
 19161 00000B6F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19162 00000B70 FC                      	cld
 19163 00000B71 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 19164 00000B73 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 19165                                  
 19166                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 19167                                  
 19168                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19169 00000B74 57                      	push	di
 19170 00000B75 06                      	push	es
 19171                                  
 19172 00000B76 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19173 00000B79 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19174 00000B7B BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 19175                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 19176 00000B7E B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 19177 00000B81 BE[0F0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 19178 00000B84 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 19179                                  
 19180 00000B86 5F                      	pop	di
 19181 00000B87 07                      	pop	es
 19182                                  
 19183 00000B88 C3                      	retn

 19185                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19186                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 19187                                  ;
 19188                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 19189                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 19190                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 19191                                  ;
 19192                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19193                                  
 19194                                  struc desc
 19195 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 19196 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 19197 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address

 19199 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 19200                                   .size:

 19213 00000B9E 93                      		db	93h
 19214 00000B9F 0000                    		dw	0
 19215 00000BA1 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 19216 00000BA3 0000                    		dw	0
 19217 00000BA5 10                      		db	10h
 19218 00000BA6 93                      		db	93h
 19219 00000BA7 0000                    		dw	0

 19224 00000BB1 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 19225                                  
 19226 00000BB9 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 19227                                  
 19228                                  
 19229                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 19230                                  
 19231                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19232                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 19233                                  
 19234                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 19235                                  
 19236                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19237                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19238                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19239                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19240                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19241                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19242                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19243                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19244                                  ;								      ;I070
 19245                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19246                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19247                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19248                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19249                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19250                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19251                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19252                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19253                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19254                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19255                                  ;								      ;I070
 19256                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19257                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19258                                  
 19259                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19260                                  	; ds = cs
 19261                                  
 19262                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19263                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 19264                                  
 19265 00000BD9 06                      	push	es
 19266 00000BDA 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 19267 00000BDC 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 19268 00000BDE B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19269 00000BE0 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 19270 00000BE2 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19271 00000BE4 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19272 00000BE6 05[B90B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 19273 00000BE9 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 19274                                  
 19275                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 19276                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 19277                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 19278                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 19279                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 19280                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19281                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax

 19284 00000BEF 8816[9D0B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl

 19287 00000BF6 0E                      	push	cs
 19288 00000BF7 07                      	pop	es

 19290 00000BFB B487                    	mov	ah,87h

 19292                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 19293                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 19294                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 19295 00000BFF 07                      	pop	es

 19299                                  ;
 19300                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19301                                  ;
 19302                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19303                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19304                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19305                                  ;		the offset.
 19306                                  ;
 19307                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 19308                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 19309                                  ;
 19310                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19311                                  
 19312                                  SaveFreeHMAPtr:
 19313 00000C01 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 19314 00000C03 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh		; HMA segment
 19315 00000C06 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19316 00000C08 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19317 00000C0B 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19318 00000C0E B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19319 00000C10 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19320 00000C12 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19321 00000C14 1E                      	push	ds
 19322                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19323                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19324                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19325 00000C15 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 19326 00000C18 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19327 00000C1A 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19328 00000C1E C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19329 00000C23 1F                      	pop	ds
 19330 00000C24 C3                      	retn
 19331

 19335                                  ;
 19336                                  ;		Checks for the presence of VDISK header at 1MB boundary
 19337                                  ;		& INT 19 vector
 19338                                  ;
 19339                                  ; Inputs  : A20 flag should be ON
 19340                                  ; Outputs : Zero set if VDISK header found else Zero cleared
 19341                                  ;

 19361 00000C41 BE1300                  	mov	si,13h

 19370                                  ;
 19371                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 19372                                  ;
 19373                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 19374                                  ;		for CPM compatibility

 20277                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20278                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20279                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20280                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20281                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20282                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20283                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20284                                  ;
 20285                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20286                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20287                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20288                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20289                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20290                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20291                                  ;
 20292                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20293                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20294                                  ;
 20295                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20296                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20297                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20298                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20299                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20300                                  ;
 20301                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20302                                  ;
 20303                                  ;			  none.
 20304                                  
 20305                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20306                                  ;
 20307                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20308                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20309                                  
 20310                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20311

 20517                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20518                                  ;
 20519                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20520                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20521                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20522                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20523                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20524                                  ; program).

 20527

 20529

 20531

 20533                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;

 20535                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next

 20537                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20538                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20539                                  ; carridge return.

 20542                                  ;character after =.

 20676                                  
 20677                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20678                                  ;
 20679                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20680                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20681                                  ;
 20682                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20683                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20684                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20685                                  
 20686                                  ParaRound:
 20687 00001169 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20688 0000116C D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20689 0000116E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20690 00001170 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20691 00001172 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20692 00001174 C3                      	retn

 20694                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20695                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20696                                  ;
 20697                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20698                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20699                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20700                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 20701                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 20702                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 20703                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 20704                                  ;
 20705                                  ;in: after relocation,
 20706                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 20707                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 20708                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 20709                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 20710                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 20711                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 20712                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 20713                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 20714                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 20715                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 20716                                  ;
 20717                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 20718                                  
 20719                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20720                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20721                                  sysinit_base:				
 20722 00001175 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 20723 0000117A 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 20724 0000117F CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 20725 00001181 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 20726 00001186 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 20727 0000118B 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 20728 0000118C 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 20729 0000118D 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 20730                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 20731                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 20732 0000118F E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 20733 00001192 263906[D802]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 20734 00001197 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 20735                                  
 20736                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 20737                                  
 20738 00001199 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 20739 0000119B 0E                      	push	cs
 20740 0000119C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20741                                  	; 30/12/2022
 20742                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 20743                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 20744 0000119D BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 20745                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 20746 000011A0 CD21                    	int	21h
 20747                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 20748                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 20749                                  
 20750                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20751                                  stall:
 20752                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20753                                  _stall: 
 20754                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20755 000011A2 F4                      	hlt 
 20756                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20757                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 20758 000011A3 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 20759                                  
 20760                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 20761 000011A5 26FF2E[D402]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 20762                                  
 20763                                  ;-------------------------------------
 20764                                  
 20765                                  sum_up:
 20766                                  
 20767                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 20768                                  ;out:  ax - result
 20769                                  ;
 20770                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 20771                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 20772                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 20773                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 20774                                  ;
 20775                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 20776                                  
 20777 000011AA 1E                      	push	ds
 20778                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20779                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 20780 000011AB 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 20781                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20782                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 20783 000011AF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20784 000011B1 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 20785 000011B3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20786 000011B5 268B0E[CE02]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 20787                                  					; whole test better fail.
 20788 000011BA D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 20789 000011BC 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 20790                                  sum1:
 20791 000011BE 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 20792 000011C0 46                      	inc	si
 20793 000011C1 46                      	inc	si
 20794 000011C2 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 20795                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 20796                                  sum_sys_code:
 20797                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20798 000011C4 BEC411                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20799                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20800                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 20801                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 20802                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 20803                                  	; 02/11/2022
 20804                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 20805                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 20806 000011C7 B9[D04E]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 20807 000011CA 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 20808 000011CC D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 20809                                  sum2:
 20810 000011CE 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 20811 000011D1 46                      	inc	si
 20812 000011D2 46                      	inc	si
 20813 000011D3 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 20814 000011D5 1F                      	pop	ds
 20815 000011D6 C3                      	retn
 20816                                  
 20817                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20818                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20819                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 20820                                  
 20821                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 20822                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 20823 000011D7 0000                    	dw	0
 20824                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 20825                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 20826 000011D9 0000                    	dw	0	
 20827                                  
 20828                                  mem_alloc_err_msgx:
 20829                                  
 20830                                         ;include msbio.cl4		; memory allocation error message
 20831                                  
 20832                                  ;SYSINIT:12F6:  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:12F6h
 20833 000011DB 0D0A                    	db	0Dh,0Ah
 20834 000011DD 4D656D6F727920616C-     	db 	'Memory allocation error $'
 20834 000011E6 6C6F636174696F6E20-
 20834 000011EF 6572726F722024     
 20835                                  
 20836                                  end_sysinit_base: ; label byte
 20837                                  	; 24/10/2022

 20840                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20841                                  ; Set_Buffer
 20842                                  ;
 20843                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 20844                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 20845                                  ;
 20846                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 20847                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 20848                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 20849                                  ;
 20850                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 20851                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 20852                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20853                                  
 20854                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 20855                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 20856                                  
 20857                                  set_buffer:
 20858 000011F6 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 20859 000011F8 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 20860 000011FB 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 20861 000011FD B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 20862                                  set_buff_1:
 20863                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20864                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 20865 000011FF 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 20866                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 20867 00001201 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 20868                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 20869 00001204 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 20870                                  
 20871 00001209 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 20872 0000120B 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 20873 00001210 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 20874                                  
 20875                                  ;	for each buffer
 20876                                  
 20877                                  nxt_buff:
 20878 00001211 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 20879 00001214 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 20880 00001216 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 20881                                  
 20882 00001218 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 20883                                  
 20884 0000121D 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 20885                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 20886 0000121E 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 20887 00001221 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 20888                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 20889                                  	; 25/10/2022
 20890 00001223 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 20891                                  
 20892 00001227 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 20893 00001229 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 20894                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 20895 0000122B C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 20896 0000122F 2EA1[6203]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 20897                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 20898 00001233 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 20899                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 20900 00001238 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 20901 0000123B 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 20902                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 20903 0000123F 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 20904                                  set_buff_2:
 20905 00001242 2E0106[6003]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 20906                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 20907 00001247 2E800E[E414]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 20908                                  	;call	round
 20909                                  	;retn
 20910                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20911 0000124D E91E31                  	jmp	round
 20912                                  
 20913                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20914                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 20915                                  ;
 20916                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 20917                                  ;
 20918                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 20919                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 20920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20921                                  
 20922                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 20923                                  GetBufferAddr:
 20924 00001250 53                      	push	bx
 20925 00001251 52                      	push	dx
 20926 00001252 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 20927 00001256 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 20928                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 20929 0000125B 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 20930                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 20931                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 20932                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20933 0000125E 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 20934 00001260 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 20935 00001262 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 20936                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 20937 00001265 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 20938 00001267 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 20939 0000126A 7508                    	jne	short got_hma
 20940 0000126C BF0000                  	mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 20941                                  	;zf=1
 20942                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 20943                                  	;zf=1
 20944 0000126F 2E8E06[6203]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 20945                                  got_hma:
 20946 00001274 5A                      	pop	dx
 20947 00001275 5B                      	pop	bx
 20948 00001276 C3                      	retn
 20949                                  
 20950                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20951                                  
 20952                                  set_buffer_info:
 20953                                  
 20954                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 20955                                  ;
 20956                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 20957                                  ;    ax = di
 20958                                  ;
 20959                                  ;out:
 20960                                  ;    above entries set.
 20961                                  
 20962                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 20963 00001277 2EFF36[BB02]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 20964                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 20965 0000127C 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 20966 00001280 2EA3[BB02]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 20967 00001284 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 20968                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 20969 00001289 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 20970                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 20971 0000128C 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 20972                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 20973 00001292 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 20974                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 20975 00001298 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 20976 0000129E C3                      	retn
 20977                                  
 20978                                  ; ======================================================================
 20979                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 20980                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20981                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20982                                  
 20983                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20984                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 20985                                  ;
 20986                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 20987                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 20988                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 20989                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 20990                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 20991                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 20992                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 20993                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 20994                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 20995                                  ;
 20996                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 20997                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 20998                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 20999                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21000                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21001                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21002                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21003                                  ;	conditions:
 21004                                  ;
 21005                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21006                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21007                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21008                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21009                                  ;
 21010                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21011                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21012                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21013                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21014                                  ;
 21015                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21016                                  ;
 21017                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21018                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21019                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21020                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21021                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21022                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21023                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21024                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21025                                  ;
 21026                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21027                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21028                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21029                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21030                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21031                                  ;
 21032                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21033                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21034                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21035                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21036                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21037                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21038                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21039                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21040                                  ;
 21041                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21042                                  
 21043                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21044                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21045                                  
 21046                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21047                                  stackinit:
 21048 0000129F 50                      	push	ax
 21049 000012A0 1E                      	push	ds
 21050 000012A1 06                      	push	es
 21051 000012A2 53                      	push	bx
 21052 000012A3 51                      	push	cx
 21053 000012A4 52                      	push	dx
 21054 000012A5 57                      	push	di
 21055 000012A6 56                      	push	si
 21056 000012A7 55                      	push	bp
 21057                                  
 21058                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21059                                  
 21060                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21061                                  	; ds = cs
 21062 000012A8 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21063 000012AB 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21064                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21065                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21066                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21067 000012AD 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21068                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 21069 000012B1 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 21070 000012B4 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 21071                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21072 000012B8 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 21073                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21074                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21075                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 21076 000012BB 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 21077                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21078 000012BF 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 21079 000012C1 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 21080                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21081                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 21082                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 21083 000012C4 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 21084                                  
 21085                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 21086                                  
 21087                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 21088                                  
 21089                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 21090                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21091                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 21092 000012C8 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 21093                                  
 21094                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 21095                                  
 21096 000012CD B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 21097                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 21098                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21099                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 21100 000012D0 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21101 000012D2 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 21102 000012D4 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 21103 000012D8 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21104 000012DA 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 21105                                  
 21106                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 21107                                  
 21108 000012DD 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 21109 000012E2 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 21110 000012E6 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 21111 000012E8 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 21112 000012EA 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21113 000012EC 06                      	push	es
 21114 000012ED 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 21115                                  
 21116                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 21117                                  
 21118 000012EE 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 21119 000012F2 FC                      	cld
 21120 000012F3 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 21121                                  
 21122 000012F5 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 21123                                  
 21124                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 21125                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 21126                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 21127                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 21128                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 21129                                  
 21130                                  buildloop:
 21131                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21132                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 21133                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21134 000012F9 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free
 21135 000012FE 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 21136                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 21137 00001302 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 21138                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 21139 00001306 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 21140                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 21141 0000130A 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 21142 0000130E 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 21143                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx

 21744                                  
 21745                                  stkinit_77:
 21746 0000142E BEDC01                  	mov	si,77h*4 ; 476
 21747

 21749                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21750 00001431 E83500                  	call	int_xx_first_check
 21751 00001434 730C                    	jnc	short int_77_end ; int_77_first
 21752                                  
 21753                                  ; 14/12/2022
 21754                                  %if 0

 21799 00001442 1E                      	push	ds
 21800 00001443 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; look at the model byte
 21801 00001446 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21802 00001448 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; pc convertible?

 21878                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21879                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21880                                  
 21881                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21882                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 21883                                  
 21884                                  new_init_loop:
 21885                                  
 21886                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 21887                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 21888                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 21889                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 21890                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 21891                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 21892                                  
 21893 00001494 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 21894 00001497 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 21895 00001499 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 21896 0000149D 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 21897                                  
 21898 000014A0 1E                      	push	ds
 21899                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 21900                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 21901                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21902 000014A1 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 21903 000014A4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 21904 000014A6 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 21905 000014A9 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 21906 000014AB 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 21907 000014AF 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 21908 000014B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 21909                                  
 21910 000014B3 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 21911 000014B6 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 21912 000014BA C3                      	retn
 21913                                  
 21914                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 21915                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21916                                  
 21917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21918                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 21919                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 21920                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 21921                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 21922                                  ;out: devmark established.
 21923                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 21924                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 21925                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21926                                  
 21927                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21928                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 21929                                  
 21930                                  setdevmark:
 21931                                  
 21932 000014BB 06                      	push	es
 21933 000014BC 51                      	push	cx
 21934                                  
 21935 000014BD 2E8B0E[6203]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 21936 000014C2 2E890E[E214]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 21937 000014C7 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 21938                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21939                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 21940 000014C9 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 21941 000014CD 41                      	inc	cx
 21942                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 21943 000014CE 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 21944                                  
 21945 000014D3 59                      	pop	cx
 21946 000014D4 07                      	pop	es
 21947 000014D5 2EFF06[6203]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 21948 000014DA C3                      	retn

 22153                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22154                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 22189 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
