 22192                                  endstruc
 22193                                  
 22194                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22195                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22196                                  ;
 22197                                  ;
 22198                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22199                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22200                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22201                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22202                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22203                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22204                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22205                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22206                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22207                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22208                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22209                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22210                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22211                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22212                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22213                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22214                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22215                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22216                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22217                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22218                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22219                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22220                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22221                                  ;	   :
 22222                                  ;
 22223                                  ;Note:
 22224                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22225                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22226                                  ;
 22227                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22228                                  ;
 22229                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22230                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22231                                  ;
 22232                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22233                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22234                                  ;
 22235                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22236                                  ;
 22237                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22238                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22239                                  ;
 22240                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22241                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22242                                  ;
 22243                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22244                                  ;
 22245                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22246                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22247                                  ;
 22248                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22249                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22250                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22251                                  ;
 22252                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22253                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22254                                  ;
 22255                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22256                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22257                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22258                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22259                                  
 22260                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22261                                  
 22262                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22263                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22264                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22265                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22266                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22267                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22268                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22269                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22270                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22271                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22272                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22273                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22274                                  
 22275                                  ;**** Function flags
 22276                                  
 22277                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22278                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22279                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22280                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22281                                  
 22282                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22283                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22284 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22285 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22286 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22287 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22288 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22289 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22290                                  endstruc
 22291                                  
 22292                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22293                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22294                                  ;
 22295                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22296                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22297                                  ;	     +-
 22298                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22299                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22300                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22301                                  ;	     |	:
 22302                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22303                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22304                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22305                                  ;	     |	:
 22306                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22307                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22308                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22309                                  ;	     +-	:
 22310                                  ;
 22311                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22312                                  ;
 22313                                  ;Note:
 22314                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22315                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22316                                  ;
 22317                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22318                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22319                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22320                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22321                                  
 22322                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22323                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22324                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22325                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22326                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22327                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22328                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22329                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22330                                  
 22331                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22332 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22333 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22334 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22335 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22336 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22337                                  endstruc
 22338                                  
 22339                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22340                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22341                                  ;
 22342                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22343                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22344                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22345                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22346                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22347                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22348                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22349                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22350                                  ;
 22351                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22352                                  ;
 22353                                  ;            +-
 22354                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22355                                  ;	    | or
 22356                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22357                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22358                                  ;	    | or
 22359                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22360                                  ;	    | or
 22361                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22362                                  ;	    | or
 22363                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22364                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22365                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22366                                  ;	    | or
 22367                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22368                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22369                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22370                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22371                                  ;	    +-
 22372                                  ;
 22373                                  ;
 22374                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22375                                  ;      list.
 22376                                  ;
 22377                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22378                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22379                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22380                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22381                                  
 22382                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure

 22384 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22385 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22386 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22387 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22388                                  endstruc

 22416                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 22417                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 22418                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 22419                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 22501                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 22502                                  ; ======================================================================
 22503                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22504                                  
 22505                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22506                                  ; SysParse;
 22507                                  ;
 22508                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22509                                  ;
 22510                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22511                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22512                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22513                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22514                                  ;
 22515                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22516                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22517                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22518                                  ;
 22519                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22520                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22521                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22522                                  ;
 22523                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22524                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22525                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22526                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22527                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22528                                  ;
 22529                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22530                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22531                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22532                                  ;
 22533                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22534                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22535                                  ;
 22536                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22537                                  ;
 22538                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22539                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22540                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22541                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22542                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22543                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22544                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22545                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22546                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22547                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22548                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22549                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22550                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22551                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22552                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22553                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22554                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22555                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22556                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22557                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22558                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22559                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22560                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22561                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22562                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22563                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22564                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22565                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22566                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22567                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22568                                  
 22569                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22570                                  
 22571                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22572                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22573                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22574                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22575                                  
 22576                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22577                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22578                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22579                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22580                                  ;
 22581                                  
 22582                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22583                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22584                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22585                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22586                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22587                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22588                                  
 22589                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22590                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22591                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22592                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22593                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22594                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22595                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22596                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22597                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22598                                  
 22599                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22600                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22601                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22602                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22603                                  ;	     segment.
 22604                                  
 22605                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 22606                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22607                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22608                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22609                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22610                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22611                                  
 22612                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 22613                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 22614                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 22615                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 22616                                  
 22617                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 22618                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 22619                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 22620                                  
 22621                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 22622                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 22623                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 22624                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 22625                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 22626                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 22627                                  
 22628                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 22629                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 22630                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 22631                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 22632                                  
 22633                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 22634                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.
 22635

 22637

 22639                                  ;	     psdata buffer should have cs.

 23130                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23131                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23132                                  ;
 23133                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23134                                  ;
 23135                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23136                                  ;	    AL = type
 23137                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23138                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23139                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23140                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23141                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23142                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23143                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23144                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23145                                  ;
 23146                                  ; Output:   None
 23147                                  ;
 23148                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23149                                  ;
 23150                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23151                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23152                                  
 23153                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23159 000017DB 26886501                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 23160 000017DF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 23162 000017E4 26894502                	mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],ax 
 23163                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result
 23164 000017E8 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23165                                  _$P_RLT04:				;AN000;
 23166 000017E9 3C01                    	cmp	al,_$P_Number		;AN000; if number
 23167 000017EB 750A                    	jne	short _$P_RLT00		;AN000;

 23353                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23354                                  ;

 23356                                  ;

 23380

 23383 0000191D 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23384

 23386                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;

 23437                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;

 23474

 23520                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23521                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23522                                  ;
 23523                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23524                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23525                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23526                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23527                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23528                                  ;
 23529                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23530                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23531                                  ;
 23532                                  ; Output:    None
 23533                                  ;
 23534                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 23535                                  ;
 23536                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 23537                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23538                                  
 23539                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23540                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 23541                                  
 23542                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 23543 0000198A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23544 0000198B 2E800E[F814]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 23545 00001991 2E8026[F814]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 23546 00001997 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 23547 0000199A 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 23548 0000199C 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 23549                                  
 23550 0000199E 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 23551 000019A0 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 23552                                  
 23553 000019A2 2E800E[F814]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 23554                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 23555 000019A8 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 23556                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 23557 000019A9 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 23558 000019AC 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23559 000019AD C3                      	retn
 23560                                  
 23561                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23562                                  
 23563                                  	; 26/10/2022
 23564                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;

 23566 000019AF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 23567 000019B0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 23568 000019B1 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23569 000019B2 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 23570 000019B4 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 23571 000019B6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 23572                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 23573 000019B7 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23574 000019BA 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?

 23576

 23578 000019C1 7239                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 23579                                  
 23580 000019C3 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 23581 000019C5 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 23582 000019C7 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 23583 000019C9 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 23584 000019CB E8D100                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 23585 000019CE 722C                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 23586

 23589 000019D4 D1E2                    	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 23590 000019D6 D1D1                    	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 23591 000019D8 E8C400                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 23592 000019DB 721F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit

 24458                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24459                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24460                                  ;
 24461                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24462                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24463                                  ;
 24464                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24465                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24466                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24467                                  ;
 24468                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24469                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24470                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24471                                  
 24472                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24473                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24474                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24475                                  ;
 24476                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24477                                  
 24478                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24479                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24480                                  
 24481                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24482                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24483 00001D47 8D2E[0115]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24484                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24485 00001D4B 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24486 00001D4D 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24487                                  
 24488                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24489 00001D4F 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24490 00001D51 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24491                                  
 24492 00001D53 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24493                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24494                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24495 00001D54 C3                      	retn
 24496                                  
 24497                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24498                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24499                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24500                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24501                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24502                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24503                                  
 24504                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24505                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24506 00001D55 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24507 00001D57 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24508                                  
 24509 00001D59 2E800E[F814]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24510                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24511                                  
 24512                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24513                                  	; cf=0
 24514                                  	;retn
 24515                                  
 24516                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24517                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24518                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24519 00001D5F F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24520                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24521                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24522 00001D60 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24523                                  
 24524                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24525                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24526                                  ;
 24527                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24528                                  ;
 24529                                  ;  Input:
 24530                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24531                                  ;
 24532                                  ;  Output:
 24533                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24534                                  ;
 24535                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24536                                  ;
 24537                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24538                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24539                                  
 24540                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24541 00001D61 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24542 00001D62 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24543 00001D63 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24544                                  	
 24545 00001D64 2E833E[F514]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24546 00001D6A 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24547                                  
 24548 00001D6C 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24549 00001D6D 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24550 00001D6E 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24551 00001D6F 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24552 00001D70 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24553 00001D71 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24554 00001D72 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24555 00001D73 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24556 00001D75 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24557 00001D77 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24558 00001D7A CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24559                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24560 00001D7C 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24561 00001D7E 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24562 00001D80 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24563 00001D81 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24564 00001D82 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24565 00001D83 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24566 00001D84 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24567 00001D85 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24568 00001D86 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24569 00001D87 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24570                                  
 24571                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24572 00001D89 2E8936[F314]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24573 00001D8E 2E891E[F514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24574                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24575 00001D93 2E8B36[F314]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24576 00001D98 2E8E1E[F514]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24577                                  
 24578                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24579 00001D9D 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24580 00001DA0 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24581                                  
 24582 00001DA2 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24583 00001DA4 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24584                                  
 24585 00001DA6 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24586 00001DA9 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24587                                  
 24588 00001DAB F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24589 00001DAC EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24590                                  
 24591                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24592 00001DAE 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24593 00001DAF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24594                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24595 00001DB0 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24596                                  
 24597                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24598                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24599                                  	; cf=0
 24600                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24601                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24602 00001DB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24603 00001DB3 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24604 00001DB4 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24605 00001DB5 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24606

 25163                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25164                                  
 25165                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25166                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25167                                  
 25168                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25169                                  ;
 25170                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25171                                  ;
 25172                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25173                                  ;
 25174                                  ;   Modification log:
 25175                                  ;
 25176                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25177                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25178                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25179                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25180                                  ;
 25181                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25182                                  ;
 25183                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25184                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25185                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25186                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25187                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25188                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25189                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25190                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25191                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25192                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25193                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25194                                  ;
 25195                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25196                                  
 25197                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25198                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25199                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25200                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25201                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25202                                  
 25203                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25204                                  
 25205                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25206                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25207                                  
 25208                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25209                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25210                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25211                                  
 25212                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25213                                  ;
 25214                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25215                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25216                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25217                                  ;	           line.
 25218                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25219                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25220                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25221                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25222                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25223                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25224                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25225                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25226                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25227                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25228                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25229                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25230                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25231                                  ;	           for details).
 25232                                  
 25233 00001FB5 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 25234 00001FB6 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 25235 00001FB7 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 25236 00001FB9 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 25237 00001FBA 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25238 00001FCA 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25239 00001FEA 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 25240 00001FEB 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 25241 00001FEC 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 25242                                  
 25243                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25244                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25245                                  
 25246                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25247                                  
 25248                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 25249                                  
 25250                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 25255                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25256                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25257                                  
 25258                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25259                                  
 25260 00001FED 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25261 00001FEF 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25262 00001FF1 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25263 00001FF3 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25264 00001FF7 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver

 25267 00001FFB 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25268                                  ;
 25269 00001FFC 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25270 00001FFD 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25271 00001FFF 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25272 00002001 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)

 25284 0000200F 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)

 25298                                  
 25299                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25300                                  
 25301                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25302                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 25303                                  
 25304                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25305                                  ;
 25306                                  ; procedure : doconf
 25307                                  ;
 25308                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 25309                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 25310                                  ;
 25311                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25312                                  
 25313                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25314                                  doconf:
 25315 00002021 0E                      	push	cs
 25316 00002022 1F                      	pop	ds
 25317                                  
 25318 00002023 B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 25319                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 25320 00002026 CD21                    	int	21h
 25321 00002028 8816[9247]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 25322                                  
 25323                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 25324                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25325                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25326                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 25327 0000202C 8816[9047]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 25328                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25329                                  
 25330 00002030 BA[A746]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 25331 00002033 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 25332                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 25333 00002036 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25334 00002037 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25335 00002039 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 25336                                  
 25337                                  ; 31/12/2022
 25338                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25339                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25340 0000203B E85C19                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 25341                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 25342                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 25343 0000203E C606[CB02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 25344 00002043 C3                      	retn
 25345                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 25346 00002044 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 25347 00002046 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25348 00002048 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25349                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 25350 0000204A B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 25351 0000204D CD21                    	int	21h
 25352 0000204F A3[5403]                	mov	[count],ax
 25353                                  
 25354 00002052 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25355                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 25356 00002054 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 25357 00002057 CD21                    	int	21h
 25358                                  
 25359                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 25360 00002059 8B16[A302]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 25361                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25362                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 25363                                  
 25364 0000205D A1[5403]                	mov	ax,[count]
 25365 00002060 A3[CE02]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25366 00002063 E803F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25367 00002066 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25368                                  
 25369                                  ; 31/12/2022
 25370                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25371                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25372                                  ;
 25373                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25374                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25375                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25376                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25377                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25378                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25379                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25380                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25381                                  ;
 25382 00002068 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25383 00002069 8916[DD14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 25384 0000206D 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 25385                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 25386                                  
 25387 0000206F 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 25388                                  	
 25389                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25390 00002072 8916[A302]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 25391 00002076 8916[A102]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 25392                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25393                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 25394                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 25395                                  	
 25396                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25397                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25398                                  	; ds <> cs 
 25399                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 25400                                   
 25401 0000207A 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 25402 0000207C 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25403                                  
 25404 0000207E 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25405 00002080 2E8B0E[5403]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25406 00002085 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25407                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 25408 00002087 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 25409 00002088 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25410 0000208A 9C                      	pushf
 25411                                  
 25412                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25413                                  
 25414 0000208B 50                      	push	ax
 25415 0000208C 57                      	push	di
 25416 0000208D 51                      	push	cx
 25417 0000208E B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25418 00002090 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25419 00002092 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25420 00002094 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25421 00002096 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25422                                  
 25423                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25424                                  
 25425 00002098 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25426                                  
 25427                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25428                                  
 25429                                  puteol:
 25430 00002099 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25431 0000209B AA                      	stosb
 25432 0000209C B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25433 0000209E AA                      	stosb

 25535                                  
 25536 0000210A 50                              push    ax                      ;
 25537 0000210B E8AF08                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25538 0000210E 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25539 00002110 E8AA08                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25540 00002113 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25541 00002115 A3[AD02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25542 00002118 58                              pop     ax
 25543                                  ;
 25544                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25545                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25546                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25547                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25548                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25549                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25550                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25551                                  ;   spot.
 25552                                  ;
 25553                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25554                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25555                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25556                                  ;   retrieved.
 25557                                  ;
 25558 00002119 803E[CB02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 25564 0000212C 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no

 25570                                  ; 31/12/2022

 25754                                  ; buffer command
 25755                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25756                                  
 25757                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25758                                  ;									      *
 25759                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 25760                                  ;									      *
 25761                                  ; input :								      *
 25762                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 25763                                  ; output:								      *
 25764                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 25765                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 25766                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 25767                                  ;									      *
 25768                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 25769                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 25770                                  ; logic:								      *
 25771                                  ; {									      *
 25772                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 25773                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 25774                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 25775                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 25776                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 25777                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 25778                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 25779                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 25780                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 25781                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 25782                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 25783                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 25784                                  ;	};								      *
 25785                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 25786                                  ; };									      *
 25787                                  ;									      *
 25788                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25789                                  
 25790                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25791                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 25792                                  tryb:
 25793 000021E5 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 25794 000021E8 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 25795                                  
 25796                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 25797                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 25798                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25799                                  ;%if 0
 25800                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25801 000021EA E8BD1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 25802 000021ED 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25803                                  ;endif
 25804                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 25805                                  
 25806                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25807                                  	; 18/12/2022
 25808 000021EF 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 25809                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 25810 000021F1 880E[FD1D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 25811                                  
 25812 000021F5 BF[B61D]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 25813                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 25814                                  	; 03/01/2023
 25815                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 25816                                  do7:
 25817 000021F8 E86B07                  	call	sysinit_parse
 25818 000021FB 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 25819                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 25820                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 25821                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25822                                  ;sr7:
 25823                                  	;jmp	coff
 25824                                  	; 03/01/2023
 25825 000021FD E9AD06                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 25826                                  if7:
 25827 00002200 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 25828 00002203 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 25829                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 25830 00002205 813E[011E][F61D]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 25831                                  	;jne	short if11
 25832                                  	; 31/12/2022
 25833 0000220B 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 25834                                  
 25835                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 25836                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 25837                                  if11:
 25838                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 25839 0000220D A1[031E]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]

 25842

 25845                                  	; 31/12/2022

 25847                                  if13:

 25849                                  en11:

 25852 0000221F 833E[F91D]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99

 25854                                  
 25855                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 25856                                  ;	jne	short if18
 25857

 25859 00002229 C706[FB1D]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 25860 0000222F EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 25861                                  if18:
 25862 00002231 A1[F91D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 25863 00002234 A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 25864                                  
 25865 00002237 A1[FB1D]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]

 25876                                  sr7:

 25879                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25880                                  ; break command
 25881                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25882                                  
 25883                                  ;****************************************************************************
 25884                                  ;									    *
 25885                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 25886                                  ;									    *
 25887                                  ; input :								    *
 25888                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 25889                                  ; output:								    *
 25890                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 25891                                  ;									    *
 25892                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 25893                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 25894                                  ; logic:								    *

 26533                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 26534                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the

 27459                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27460                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27461                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27462                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27463                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27464                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27465                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27466                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27467                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27468                                  
 27469                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27470                                  ;									  *
 27471                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27472                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27473                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27474                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27475                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27476                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27477                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27478                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27479                                  ; input :								  *
 27480                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27481                                  ; output:								  *
 27482                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27483                                  ;									  *
 27484                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27485                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27486                                  ; logic:								  *
 27487                                  ; {									  *
 27488                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27489                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27490                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27491                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27492                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27493                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27494                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27495                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27496                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27497                                  ;	     }								  *
 27498                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27499                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27500                                  ;	};								  *
 27501                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27502                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27503                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27504                                  ; };									  *
 27505                                  ;**************************************************************************
