 28239                                  sysinit_parse:
 28240                                  
 28241                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28242                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28243                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28244                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28245                                  ;
 28246                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28247                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28248                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28249                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28250                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28251                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28252                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28253                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28254                                  ;	 procedure.
 28255                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28256                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28257                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28258                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28259                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28260                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28261                                  
 28262                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)

 28588                                  ;
 28589                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28590                                  ;
 28591                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28592                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28593                                  ;
 28594                                  ;	Output : none
 28595                                  ;
 28596                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28597                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28598                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28599                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28600                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28601                                  ;
 28602                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28603                                  
 28604                                  LieInt12Mem:
 28605                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28606                                  	; ds = cs
 28607 00002A26 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 28608                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 28609                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28610 00002A29 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28611 00002A2C 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28612                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28613                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28614                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28615                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28616                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28617                                  	; ds = cs
 28618 00002A2E 803E[0B20]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28619 00002A33 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28620 00002A35 A1[F11F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28621                                  lim_set:
 28622                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28623                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28624                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28625                                  ;limx:
 28626                                  	;retn
 28627                                  	
 28628                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28629                                  
 28630                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28631                                  ;
 28632                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28633                                  ;
 28634                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28635                                  ;	Output : none
 28636                                  ;
 28637                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28638                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28639                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28640                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28641                                  ;
 28642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28643                                  
 28644                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28645                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28646 00002A38 1E                      	push	ds
 28647 00002A39 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28648 00002A3C 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28649 00002A3E 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28650 00002A42 2E891E[0F20]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28651 00002A47 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28652 00002A49 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28653 00002A4B A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28654 00002A4E 2EC606[0E20]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28655 00002A54 1F                      	pop	ds
 28656                                  ;limx:
 28657 00002A55 C3                      	retn
 28658                                  
 28659                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28660                                  ;
 28661                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28662                                  ;
 28663                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28664                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28665                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28666                                  ;
 28667                                  ;	Output : none
 28668                                  ;
 28669                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 28670                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28671                                  ;
 28672                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28673                                  
 28674                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28675                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28676                                  	; ds = cs
 28677 00002A56 803E[0E20]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28678                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 28679                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 28680                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28681 00002A5B 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28682                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28683 00002A5D B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28684 00002A60 8826[0E20]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28685                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28686                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28687 00002A64 1E                      	push	ds
 28688                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28689 00002A65 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28690 00002A67 2EA1[0F20]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28691 00002A6B A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28692 00002A6E 1F                      	pop	ds
 28693                                  timx:
 28694 00002A6F C3                      	retn
 28695

 28747                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28748                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 28749                                  
 28750                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28751                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28752                                  
 28753                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28754                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28755                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28756                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28757                                  
 28758                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28759                                  ;
 28760                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28761                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28762                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28763                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28764                                  ;
 28765                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28766                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28767                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28768                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28769                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28770                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28771                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28772                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28773                                  ; available during the load.
 28774                                  ;
 28775                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28776                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28777                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28778                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28779                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28780                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28781                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28782                                  ;
 28783                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28784                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28785                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28786                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28787                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28788                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28789                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28790                                  ;
 28791                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28792                                  
 28793                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28794                                  
 28795                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28796                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28797                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28798                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28799                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28800                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28801                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28802                                  
 28803                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28804                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28805                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28806                                  
 28807                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28808                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28809                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28810                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28811                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28812                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28813                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28814                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28815                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 28816                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28817                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28818                                  
 28819                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28820                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 28821                                  
 28822                                  InitVar:
 28823                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28824                                  	; ds = cs
 28825                                  
 28826                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28827                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28828                                  	;push	ax
 28829                                  	;push	cx
 28830                                  	;push	di
 28831 00002A9A 06                      	push	es
 28832                                  
 28833                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28834 00002A9B 0E                      	push	cs
 28835 00002A9C 07                      	pop	es
 28836                                  
 28837 00002A9D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 28838                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28839                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28840                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28841                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28842                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28843                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28844                                  
 28845                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28846                                  	; ds = cs
 28847 00002A9F A2[B61F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28848 00002AA2 A2[B51F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28849 00002AA5 A3[B71F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28850 00002AA8 C606[B91F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28851                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28852 00002AAD A2[EC1F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 28853                                  
 28854 00002AB0 FC                      	cld
 28855                                  
 28856 00002AB1 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28857 00002AB4 BF[BA1F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28858 00002AB7 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28859

 28861                                  	; 01/01/2033

 28863 00002ABB BF[CA1F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28864 00002ABE F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28865                                  
 28866                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28867                                  
 28868                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28869 00002AC0 07                      	pop	es
 28870                                  	; 03/01/2023
 28871                                  	;pop	di
 28872                                  	;pop	cx
 28873                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 28874                                  
 28875 00002AC1 C3                      	retn
 28876                                  
 28877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28878                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28879                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28880                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28881                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28882                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28883                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28884                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28885                                  
 28886                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 28887                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 28888                                  FixMem:
 28889                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28890                                  	;push	ax
 28891                                  	;push	bx
 28892                                  	;push	cx
 28893                                  	;push	dx
 28894 00002AC2 06                      	push	es
 28895                                  
 28896 00002AC3 E84B00                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28897                                  
 28898 00002AC6 E80E02                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28899 00002AC9 7241                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28900                                  
 28901 00002ACB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28902                                  
 28903                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28904                                  
 28905 00002ACD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28906 00002ACF 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28907 00002AD1 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28908                                  
 28909                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28910                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28911                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28912                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28913                                  
 28914 00002AD2 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28915 00002AD6 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28916 00002ADB 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28917 00002ADD 7518                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28918                                  
 28919                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28920                                  
 28921 00002ADF 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 28922 00002AE4 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 28923 00002AE6 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 28924                                  
 28925 00002AEA 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 28926 00002AEF 83C301                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 28927 00002AF2 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 28928                                  
 28929                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 28930                                  
 28931 00002AF7 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 28932 00002AF9 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 28933                                  
 28934 00002AFE 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 28935 00002B00 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 28936 00002B05 43                      	inc	bx
 28937 00002B06 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 28938                                  
 28939                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 28940 00002B08 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 28941 00002B0A 75C6                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 28942                                  fmX:	
 28943 00002B0C E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 28944                                  
 28945 00002B0F 07                      	pop	es
 28946                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28947                                  	;pop	dx
 28948                                  	;pop	cx
 28949                                  	;pop	bx
 28950                                  	;pop	ax
 28951                                  
 28952 00002B10 C3                      	retn
 28953                                  
 28954                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28955                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 28956                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28957                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 28958                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 28959                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28960                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 28961                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28962                                  
 28963                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 28964                                  fm_link:
 28965 00002B11 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 28966 00002B14 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 28967                                  
 28968                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 28969                                  	;
 28970                                  	;push	es
 28971                                  	;push	cs
 28972                                  	;pop	es
 28973                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 28974                                  	;pop	es
 28975                                  	
 28976                                  	; 01/01/2023
 28977                                  	; ds = cs
 28978                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 28979 00002B16 A2[EA1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 28980                                  
 28981 00002B19 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28982 00002B1C BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 28983 00002B1F CD21                    	int	21h
 28984 00002B21 C3                      	retn
 28985                                  
 28986                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28987                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 28988                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28989                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 28990                                  ; EXIT:     None
 28991                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28992                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 28993                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28994                                  
 28995                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 28996                                  fm_unlink:
 28997 00002B22 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 28998                                  	
 28999                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29000                                  	;
 29001                                  	;push	ds
 29002                                  	;push	cs
 29003                                  	;pop	ds
 29004                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29005                                  	;pop	ds
 29006                                  	
 29007                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29008                                  	; ds = cs
 29009                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29010 00002B24 8A1E[EA1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 29011                                  
 29012 00002B28 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29013 00002B2B CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29014 00002B2D C3                      	retn
 29015                                  
 29016                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29017                                  
 29018                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29019                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29020                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29021                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29022                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29023                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29024                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29025                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29026                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29027                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29028                                  ;
 29029                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29030                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29031                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29032                                  ;
 29033                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29034                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29035                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29036                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29037                                  ;
 29038                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29039                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29040                                  ;
 29041                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29042                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29043                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29044                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29045                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29046                                  ;     lh
 29047                                  ;     /l
 29048                                  ;     1
 29049                                  ;     1000
 29050                                  ;     2
 29051                                  ;     print
 29052                                  ;     /d
 29053                                  ;     :lpt2
 29054                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29055                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29056                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29057                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29058                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29059                                  ; for:
 29060                                  ;    Each /L
 29061                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29062                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29063                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29064                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29065                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29066                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29067                                  
 29068                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29069                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 29070                                  
 29071                                  ParseVar:
 29072                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29073                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29074                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29075 00002B2E 1E                      	push	ds
 29076 00002B2F 06                      	push	es
 29077                                  
 29078 00002B30 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29079 00002B31 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29080 00002B32 FC                      	cld
 29081                                  
 29082                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29083                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29084                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29085                                  
 29086 00002B33 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29087 00002B34 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 29088 00002B37 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29089                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29090 00002B39 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29091 00002B3B 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29092                                  
 29093 00002B3D 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29094 00002B3E F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29095 00002B3F EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29096                                  
 29097 00002B41 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29098                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29099 00002B42 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 29100                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29101 00002B44 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29102 00002B46 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 29103                                  
 29104                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29105 00002B48 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29106                                  
 29107                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29108                                  	;
 29109                                  	;push	es
 29110                                  	;push	cs
 29111                                  	;pop	es
 29112                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29113                                  	;pop	es
 29114                                  
 29115 00002B4D 2EC606[B61F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29116                                  
 29117 00002B53 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29118                                  
 29119                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29120 00002B55 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29121 00002B57 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29122                                  
 29123                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29124 00002B59 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29125                                  
 29126 00002B5E E80E00                  	call	parseL
 29127 00002B61 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29128                                  
 29129 00002B63 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29130 00002B64 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29131                                  
 29132                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29133 00002B66 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29134 00002B69 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 29135 00002B6A 4E                      	dec	si
 29136 00002B6B F9                      	stc
 29137                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29138 00002B6C 07                      	pop	es
 29139 00002B6D 1F                      	pop	ds
 29140                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29141                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 29142 00002B6E C3                      	retn
 29143                                  
 29144                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29145                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29146                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29147                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29148                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29149                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29150                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29151                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29152                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29153                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29154                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29155                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29156                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29157                                  
 29158                                  parseL:
 29159 00002B6F AC                      	lodsb
 29160 00002B70 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29161 00002B72 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29162                                  
 29163                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29164                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29165                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29166                                  
 29167 00002B74 E8E700                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29168 00002B77 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29169 00002B79 E8B601                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29170                                  
 29171 00002B7C 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29172 00002B7E E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29173 00002B81 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29176 00002B83 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29177                                  
 29178 00002B88 AC                      	lodsb
 29179 00002B89 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29180 00002B8B 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29181                                  
 29182 00002B8D E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29183 00002B90 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29184                                  
 29185 00002B92 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29186 00002B95 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29187                                  
 29188                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29189 00002B97 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29190 00002B99 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29191                                  
 29192 00002B9B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29193 00002B9D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29194                                  
 29195                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29196                                  
 29197 00002B9F E8BC00                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29198 00002BA2 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29199                                  
 29200 00002BA4 E82201                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29201                                  
 29202 00002BA7 E87200                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29203                                  
 29204                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29205 00002BAA 2EFE06[EC1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29206                                  
 29207 00002BAF AC                      	lodsb
 29208 00002BB0 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29209 00002BB2 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 29210                                  
 29211 00002BB4 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29212 00002BB7 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29213                                  
 29214 00002BB9 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29215 00002BBC 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29216                                  
 29217                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29218 00002BBE 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29219 00002BC0 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29220                                  plE1:	
 29221                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29222 00002BC2 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29223 00002BC5 4E                      	dec	si
 29224 00002BC6 F9                      	stc
 29225 00002BC7 C3                      	retn
 29226                                  
 29227                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29228 00002BC8 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29229                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29230                                  	; cf=1
 29231                                  	;stc
 29232 00002BCB C3                      	retn
 29233                                  plSwX:	
 29234 00002BCC 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29235                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29236                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29237                                  	; cf=0
 29238                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29239 00002BCD C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29240                                  
 29241                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29242                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29243                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29244                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29245                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29246                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29247                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29248                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29249                                  
 29250                                  ;incArgc:
 29251                                  	;push	ax
 29252                                  
 29253                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29254                                  
 29255                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29256                                  
 29257                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29258                                  
 29259                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29260                                  
 29261                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29262                                  
 29263                                  	;pop	ax
 29264                                  	;retn
 29265                                  
 29266                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29267                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29268                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29269                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29270                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29271                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29272                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29273                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29274                                  
 29275                                  isEOL:
 29276 00002BCE 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29277 00002BD0 7406                    	je	short ieX
 29278 00002BD2 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29279 00002BD4 7402                    	je	short ieX
 29280 00002BD6 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29281                                  ieX:	
 29282 00002BD8 C3                      	retn
 29283                                  
 29284                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29285                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29286                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29287                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29288                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29289                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29290                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29291                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29292                                  
 29293                                  isWhite:
 29294 00002BD9 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29295 00002BDB 7406                    	je	short iwX
 29296 00002BDD 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29297 00002BDF 7402                    	je	short iwX
 29298 00002BE1 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29299                                  iwX:	
 29300 00002BE3 C3                      	retn
 29301                                  
 29302                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29303                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29304                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29305                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29306                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29307                                  ; ERROR:    None

 29353                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29354                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29355                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29356                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29357                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29358                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29359                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29360                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29361                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29362                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29363                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29364                                  
 29365                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29366                                  stowUMB:
 29367 00002BF7 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29368 00002BF9 7202                    	jb	short su10
 29369 00002BFB F9                      	stc
 29370 00002BFC C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29371                                  su10:	
 29372                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29373                                  	;push	bx
 29374                                  	;push	di
 29375                                  	;push	si
 29376                                  	;push	ds
 29377                                  	;push	es
 29378                                  	;push	cs
 29379                                  	;pop	es
 29380                                  	;push	cs
 29381                                  	;pop	ds
 29382                                  
 29383                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29384                                  	; ds <> cs
 29385                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 29386 00002BFD 2E803E[B91F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 29387                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 29388 00002C03 7504                    	jne	short su20
 29389 00002C05 2EA2[B91F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29390                                  
 29391                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29392                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29393                                  	;jne	short su20
 29394                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29395                                  su20:	
 29396 00002C09 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29397 00002C0B 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29398                                  
 29399                                  	;mov	bl,al
 29400                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 29401                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29402                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29403 00002C0D 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 29404 00002C0F 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 29405 00002C11 B001                    	mov	al,1
 29406                                  
 29407                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29408                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29409 00002C13 2E8687[BA1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29410                                  
 29411                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29412                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29413                                  	;
 29414                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29415                                  	
 29416                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29417 00002C18 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 29418 00002C1A F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 29419                                  su30:	
 29420                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29421                                  	;pop	es
 29422                                  	;pop	ds
 29423                                  	;pop	si
 29424                                  	;pop	di
 29425                                  	;pop	bx
 29426 00002C1B C3                      	retn
 29427

 29462                                  
 29463                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29464                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29465                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29466                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29467                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29469                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29470                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29471                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29472                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29473                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29474                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29475                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29476                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29477                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29478                                  
 29479                                  gnradix:
 29480 00002C28 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29481                                  
 29482                                  toDigit:
 29483 00002C2A 2E833E[282C]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29484 00002C30 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29485                                  
 29486                                  toDigit_hex:
 29487 00002C32 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29488 00002C35 7209                    	jb	short td10
 29489 00002C37 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29490 00002C3A 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29491 00002C3C 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29492                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29493 00002C3F C3                      	retn
 29494                                  td10:	
 29495 00002C40 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29496 00002C43 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29497 00002C45 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29498 00002C48 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29499 00002C4A 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29500                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29501 00002C4D C3                      	retn
 29502                                  toDigit_dec:
 29503                                  td20:	
 29504 00002C4E 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29505                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29506 00002C51 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29507 00002C53 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29508 00002C56 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29509 00002C58 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29510                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29511 00002C5B C3                      	retn
 29512                                  tdE:	
 29513 00002C5C F9                      	stc
 29514                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29515 00002C5D C3                      	retn
 29516                                  
 29517                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29518                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29519                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29520                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29521                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29522                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29523                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29524                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29525                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29526                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29527                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29528                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29529                                  
 29530                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29531                                  
 29532                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29533                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 29534                                  
 29535                                  GetXNum:
 29536                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29537                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29538                                  	;push	bx
 29539 00002C5E 51                      	push	cx ; *
 29540                                  	;push	ds
 29541                                  
 29542 00002C5F FC                      	cld
 29543 00002C60 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 29544 00002C62 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 29545 00002C64 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 29546 00002C66 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29547                                  
 29548 00002C68 2EC706[282C]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29549                                  
 29550 00002C6F 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29551                                  	;call	toDigit
 29552 00002C72 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29553                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29554                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29555 00002C75 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 29556                                  
 29557 00002C77 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 29558 00002C79 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29559 00002C7B 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29560 00002C7F 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29561 00002C82 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 29562 00002C84 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29563 00002C87 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 29564                                  
 29565                                  gxn10:	
 29566 00002C89 2EC706[282C]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29567 00002C90 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29568 00002C91 46                      	inc	si
 29569                                  
 29570                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29571                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29572                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 29573                                  ;        BX    = 0
 29574                                  ;        CH    = 0
 29575                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29576                                  
 29577                                  gxn20:	
 29578 00002C92 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 29579 00002C95 46                      	inc	si
 29580                                  
 29581 00002C96 E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 29582 00002C99 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 29583                                  
 29584 00002C9B E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 29585 00002C9E 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 29586                                  
 29587 00002CA0 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 29588 00002CA2 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 29589                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 29590                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 29591 00002CA4 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 29592                                  gxnE:	
 29593                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 29594 00002CA6 EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 29595                                  gxnQ:	
 29596 00002CA8 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 29597 00002CA9 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 29598                                  gxnX:	
 29599                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29600                                  	;pop	ds
 29601 00002CAA 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 29602                                  	;pop	bx
 29603 00002CAB C3                      	retn
 29604                                  
 29605                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29606                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 29607                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29608                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 29609                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 29610                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 29611                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29612                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29613                                  
 29614                                  mul32:
 29615 00002CAC 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29616 00002CAD 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29617 00002CAF 2EF726[282C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29618 00002CB4 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 29619                                  
 29620 00002CB6 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 29621 00002CB8 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29622                                  
 29623 00002CB9 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29624 00002CBB 2EF726[282C]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 29625 00002CC0 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29626 00002CC2 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 29627 00002CC4 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 29628 00002CC6 C3                      	retn
 29629                                  m32E:	
 29630 00002CC7 58                      	pop	ax
 29631 00002CC8 C3                      	retn
 29632                                  
 29633                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29634                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 29635                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29636                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 29637                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 29638                                  ; ERROR:   None
 29639                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 29640                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29641                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 29642                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 29643                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29644                                  
 29645                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 29646                                  toPara:
 29647 00002CC9 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 29648                                  
 29649 00002CCA B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 29650 00002CCC D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 29651 00002CCE 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 29652 00002CCF B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 29653 00002CD1 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 29654 00002CD3 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 29655                                  
 29656 00002CD5 59                      	pop	cx
 29657 00002CD6 C3                      	retn
 29658                                  
 29659                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29660                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 29661                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29662                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 29663                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 29664                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 29665                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 29666                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29667                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 29668                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 29669                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 29670                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 29671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29672                                  
 29673                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 29674                                  UmbHead:
 29675                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 29676                                  
 29677                                  	;push	si ; ?
 29678                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 29679                                  	;push	es
 29680                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 29681                                  
 29682                                  	; 09/04/2019
 29683                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 29684                                  
 29685 00002CD7 B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 29686 00002CD9 CD21                    	int	21h
 29687                                  
 29688 00002CDB 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 29689                                  	
 29690                                  	; 01/01/2023
 29691 00002CDF 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29692 00002CE2 F5                      	cmc
 29693                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 29694 00002CE3 C3                      	retn
 29695                                  
 29696                                  ; 01/01/2023
 29697                                  ;%if 0
 29698                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 29699                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 29700                                  ;
 29701                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 29702                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 29703                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 29704                                  ;	retn
 29705                                  ;uhE:	
 29706                                  ;	stc
 29707                                  ;uhX:	
 29708                                  ;	;pop	bx ; *
 29709                                  ;	;pop	es
 29710                                  ;	;pop	ds ; ?
 29711                                  ;	;pop	si ; ?
 29712                                  ;	retn
 29713                                  ;%endif
 29714

 29717                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 29719                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 29720                                  ; USES:   Flags

 29733 00002CE4 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 29734 00002CEA 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 29735                                  ism10:
